section.title: Install and Configure VSA (optional)
section.p: You can set up Virtual Storage Appliance (VSA) using the following instructions:

ol.li:
Deploy VSA by running the following command: ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts vsa-deploy.yml
Before running the next step, Deploy CMC, do the following on the first control plane node.
Look in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ for a file called cmc_hlinux_32bit_lib with the following content: deb [arch=i386] http://<deployer ip>:79/hlm/cmc32 cattleprod main If the file is not there or does not have the above content, please create it as described. The deployer ip address can be obtained by looking at the existing hlinux apt source file in that directory. This is a workaround for an issue in Beta-1 and will be fixed in Beta-2.
Next, to re-synchronize the package index files, run sudo apt-get update

Deploy CMC by running the following command:
ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cmc-deploy.yml

Note that the IP numbers of VSA VMs from ansible output appear as follows:
NIC 1: Virtual Network: vsa-network IP Address: 10.241.103.11 Subnet Mark: 255.255.255.0 Gateway: 10.241.103.1
Set your X display and launch CMC: ssh -X to the first control plane node/opt/HP/StoreVirtual/UI/jre/bin/java -jar /opt/HP/StoreVirtual/UI/UI.jar
Select Find and enter the IP addresses of the VSA virtual machines.
Choose Tasks -> Management Group -> New Management Group from the menu above.
Enter the following name for the management group, for example: hlm003-vsa-mg.
Enter the following username and password: stack / stack
Skip the DNS and SMTP sections.
Add the following cluster name: hlm003-vsa-cluster
Enter the VIP IP which can be found as the cluster IP value in the ~helion/my_cloud/stage/info/net_info.yml file
Select the checkbox to skip volume creation.
On the deployer, change to the following directory: cd ~/helion

Edit the hos/ansible/roles/_CND-CMN/templates/cinder.conf.j2 file as follows:
Change the enabled_backends line to: enabled_backends=vsa-1

Copy the VSA section, uncomment it, and fill the values as in the following example. Note that the ames assigned (in bold) are only examples. Please enter your specific values here. [vsa-1] hplefthand_password: stack hplefthand_clustername: hlm003-vsa-cluster hplefthand_api_url: https://10.241.103.7:8081/lhos hplefthand_username: stack hplefthand_iscsi_chap_enabled: true volume_backend_name: vsa-backend-hlm003 volume_driver: cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_lefthand_iscsi.HPLeftHandISCSIDriver hplefthand_debug: false Until horizon is enabled, the volume_backend_name is not used.

Run the following commands to commit and deploy the change:
git add -A git commit -m "your commit message goes here in quotes" cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml

Create a volume to verify the VSA is correctly configured, then delete the created volume.
Create a test volume from a user account and verify that the volume is successfully created in the "available" state.
Using a session with the admin creds, show the details for the test volume created in a) above cinder show <volumeId> and verify that the volume was created on the correct backend, e.g. os-vol-host-attr:host ha-volume-manager@vsa-1#vsa-backend-hlm003
Delete the test volume
